title: A good app, but missing very simple website features, and I can‚Äôt fathom why.
text: I can‚Äôt give a simple email app any stars above one, if it doesn‚Äôt have simple functionality. If you login to the gmail website. It has all of the capabilities I am complaining about. When they add basic functionality, I will give this app more stars. First, if you are in conversation mode, you cannot delete individual emails in a conversation. I cannot fathom why. Second, you cannot set starred emails to the top of main inbox. The Website can, so why again? Please update the app to repair these simple issues, and I will rethink this rating.

title: Notification issues
text: Notifications are not showing an email preview anymore after update. All my settings in my phone are correct to show it however it still will not let me preview until i open the app.

title: Horrible Support
text: As a business owner communication is vital and for weeks we have not been able to send or receive emails. With no access to a customer service line or no contact from Google concerning this matter. It has caused damage and loss of customers as well as revenue. My suggestion is do not use Google for your business communication source.

title: Payment information notice incorrect
text: This email of my automatic payment information was not correct because he states that it was declined.. However I also got notifications from my bank that the payment went there successfully. So please get your information correct before sending me false notifications on my automatic payment!!

title: Organization
text: The Gmail app helps keep me organized. Sorting through emails is a breeze. I only wish there was a way to create a new label nested under a previous label in the app the same way there is in browser.

title: Not a great experience
text:
I‚Äôm just going to list the issues I have with Gmail.
1. Glitchy-It swapped emails from my inbox & important folders to the trash folder & things from the trash folder to inbox. 

2. Several of my important emails have been deleted without my knowledge. These include job related emails that I need to participate in training in order to keep my job & emails that contain items that like videos that have sentimental value that I have no idea how to transfer elsewhere.

3. I have blocked certain contacts, but I‚Äôm still receiving emails from those companies. I blocked them for a reason & they just create more clutter for me to delete.

4. In spite of the fact that I spend an hour or 2 each day of putting read, unimportant or unwanted emails in the junk & trash folders, then deleting them, 2-3 years later when the app decides to be glitchy, these old deleted emails show up like vengeful, evil spirits in a horror movie. I have to dedicate another hour to delete the same emails over & over again. Yet, my important emails get deleted by the ridiculous app. 

I have updated the app & I‚Äôve tried turning my phone off & on again, leaving my phone off overnight, clearing & cleaning, etc. It‚Äôs getting old. Too bad I can‚Äôt get paid for the hours I have to spend dealing with this. It would make a good side gig. I don‚Äôt mean to be one of those people complaining, but I‚Äôve put up with this nonsense for years before complaining.

title: Email for the people.
text: Anyone can get an email address within minutes, and it works seamlessly with the desktop version. With 15 gb free storage, you can keep just about all your email in one place. The downside is that Google adsense hits shows up as a top- or side-bar to your emails like Google searches. I‚Äôm a longtime user and have found, for myself at least, that the desktop version works best for searching through years of email.

title: Constant updating; still buggy
text: Anytime I try to attach a photo, I get error messages.  If I leave the app in the midst of writing an email, I get an error message when I return.  Too many times to count in the past few months, a significant portion of an email disappears when I hit send - but I don‚Äôt realize it unless I check my ‚Äúsent‚Äù folder.  So now I go through the hassle of copying and pasting any long email into the Keep app, before I hit send.  And equally frustrating is that messages I thought I had sent, get stored as drafts instead.  I have to constantly monitor the true performance of Gmail, by using my iPhone, which reveals the errors.  I‚Äôm very close to finding a new email app.  I‚Äôve used Gmail almost since inception, but the iPad Gmail app has become almost useless.  And it‚Äôs fairly recent so I suspect it has something to do with incompatibility with iOS updates.  But it seems okay on my iPhone - however I don‚Äôt compose long messages on my iPhone, so who knows.  It‚Äôs unacceptable.
